flow.descriptionCdata:
44a2ee01-a1bb-43db-9e2b-405ee694d2f4.00a1b28a-24ad-4d5c-9348-7802fced45ee.description=
Adds two numbers together

Inputs\:
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
The sum of the two numbers.

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.
44a2ee01-a1bb-43db-9e2b-405ee694d2f4.0c784433-d484-43ed-81c2-cc9d99ac4929.description=Generic flow to send an e-mail 44a2ee01-a1bb-43db-9e2b-405ee694d2f4.10497c75-8827-4b9b-98f6-2f336237d611.description=
Runs a SQL query against an Oracle database, using the information in the tnsnames.ora file.  
The first row is returned on the first run of the operation. Subsequent calls with the same information return the other rows.

Inputs\:
    TNSPath -The path to the folder of the TNS file tnsnames.ora. This path must be accessible by the OO RAS service. For example, if the RAS and the Oracle server are installed on the same Windows system, the TNSPath might look like “C\:\app\Administrator\product\11.1.0\db_1\network\admin”. If the RAS and the Oracle server are on different Windows systems, you can copy the tnsnames.ora file  to the RAS system. The TNSPath might look like “C\:\Program Files\Hewlett-Packard\Operations Orchestration\RAS\Java\Default\webapp\conf” or “C\:\Temp” depending on where you place the .ora file. 
    TNSEntry - The entry name in the tnsnames.ora file that contains the connection information. For example, the value for the TNSEntry input is “TestEntry” if the content in the tnsnames.ora file looks like the following\: 

TestEntry \=
  (DESCRIPTION \=
   (ADDRESS \= (PROTOCOL \= TCP)(HOST \= 16.110.111.111)(PORT \= 1521))
   (CONNECT_DATA \=
     (SERVER \= DEDICATED)
     (SERVICE_NAME \= orcl)
   )
 )

    Username - The username to connect to the Oracle database. 
    Password - The password for the Username.
    Command - The command to execute. 
    Delimiter – The delimiter to use between the columns in the returnResult result.
    Key – The key to use to keep multiple query results distinct.
    timeout - Seconds to wait before timing out the SQL command execution.
Default values\: 0 

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. Returned the data returned for each row separated by the value you specified in the Delimiter input (for example, “key16|lst|16”).
    columnNames - The names of the columns returned, separated by the value you specified in the Delimiter input (for example, “MYKEY|NAME|ID”).
    rowsLeft - The number of rows remaining that match the query. 

Responses\:
    more items - More rows are available for retrieval.
    no more items - No more rows are available.
    failure - There was an error executing the command.

Notes\:
1. This operation only supports Oracle. 
2. This operation can only execute the "SELECT" statement. For statements that modify the database, use the TNS Names SQL Command operation.
44a2ee01-a1bb-43db-9e2b-405ee694d2f4.10808ae0-a9b1-4595-aa62-e705be19b1c0.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 44a2ee01-a1bb-43db-9e2b-405ee694d2f4.1c7de300-1873-4434-9496-747d314bfee5.description=Generic flow to send an e-mail 44a2ee01-a1bb-43db-9e2b-405ee694d2f4.329f2f72-6ccb-4fce-b83c-dac920d58f4d.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 44a2ee01-a1bb-43db-9e2b-405ee694d2f4.4ad3c2cf-2198-455b-af40-53a90439fc15.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 44a2ee01-a1bb-43db-9e2b-405ee694d2f4.4e99980a-0cab-489e-af98-49fa2386756e.description=
Check to see if the value stored in a specified flow variable, denoted by key, is null.

Inputs\:
keyName - The key to check, i.e. the name of the flow variable.

Returns\: 
The value in the specified key, i.e. flow variable.

Responses\:
isNull - If the key is a null pointer, i.e. the flow variable doesn't have an assigned value.
notNull - If some value is stored in the key, i.e the flow variable has a value assigned.
44a2ee01-a1bb-43db-9e2b-405ee694d2f4.6711e5b8-882e-40dc-a505-04868a64c2ce.description=Generic flow to send an e-mail 44a2ee01-a1bb-43db-9e2b-405ee694d2f4.6a85fb34-cc65-4f43-b081-b1dd54e5b362.description=Generic flow to send an e-mail 44a2ee01-a1bb-43db-9e2b-405ee694d2f4.70434e37-2761-48d9-ba8e-11eb30e6c56b.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 44a2ee01-a1bb-43db-9e2b-405ee694d2f4.87928bc1-6596-4d1f-b84e-bf66f398dfdc.callout=For all Server Components, add disk 44a2ee01-a1bb-43db-9e2b-405ee694d2f4.92aba687-42df-4c60-b162-03bc720f2c62.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 44a2ee01-a1bb-43db-9e2b-405ee694d2f4.b5227002-36c1-4a7d-9686-9ded453480e2.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 44a2ee01-a1bb-43db-9e2b-405ee694d2f4.c040147a-bd1d-4954-b9f4-ea17c14f650a.description=
This operation is used to retrieve a value from a list. When the index of an element from a list is known, this operation can be used to extract the element.

Inputs\:
    list - A list to get the value from.
    delimiter - The delimiter that separates values in the list.
Default value\: ','
    index - The index of the value (starting at 0) to retrieve from the list.
Valid values\: an integer, end (for the last element), end-1 (for the second to last element)

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the value found at the specified index in the list, if the value specified for the "index" input field is positive and less than the size of the list. Otherwise, it contains the value specified for "index".

Responses\:
     success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
     failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
44a2ee01-a1bb-43db-9e2b-405ee694d2f4.c6e147aa-2335-43f8-b26e-27186b5e6aac.description=Generic flow to send an e-mail 44a2ee01-a1bb-43db-9e2b-405ee694d2f4.cc81f30b-7e23-45b6-b191-89da4bac3664.description=This workflow returns the component properties and values using Artifact APIs. result\: propertyNameValuesList\: pipe separated list of property name and values ( where each property name and values would be ; seprated and multiple values would be , seprated) e.g. - property 1; value1,value2|property 2; value3|property 3; value3,value4|........ 44a2ee01-a1bb-43db-9e2b-405ee694d2f4.d2afc06d-23c7-4dbd-ab3b-87eddf764f30.description=Generic flow to send an e-mail 44a2ee01-a1bb-43db-9e2b-405ee694d2f4.d8ea4909-ff46-4591-82b1-c7ab37f53377.description=
This operation iterates through a list of values. It is not recommended to modify the value of the "list" and "separator" inputs during the iteration process.

Inputs\:
    list - The list to iterate through.
    separator - A delimiter separating the list elements.
Default value\: ‘,’ (comma) 

Results\:
    resultString - The current list element (if the response is "has more").

Responses\:
    has more - Another value was found in the list and it has been returned.
    no more - The iterator has gone through the entire list. This response is returned once per list iteration.  A subsequent call to the List iterator operation restarts the list iteration process.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Note\:
   The position of the iterator in the list is tracked by each step's unique identifier. Therefore, you can simultaneously iterate through the same list from multiple steps.
flow.name: pc_lc_add_dedicated_disk

staticBinding.value: select count(*) from diskdrive where hostname='${primaryNodeHostname}'

[{"server.csaname":"${server.csaname}"},{"flow.action":"Add Disk${disk.size}"},{"flow.error":"You reached the maximum disk size or number of disks on this server"},{"servicedesk.email":"${pc.email.servicedesk}"}]
